conclusion: Determine the heat transferred by the gas during the process from state A to state C.
Change in internal energy (ΔU) depends only on the change in temperature for an ideal gas.
Internal energy U is a function of temperature T, use formula ΔU = nCvΔT.
Temperature at state A is 27°C (300 K).
Assuming states A and C are at the same temperature, ΔT = 0, thus ΔU = 0.
Work done by the gas is given by the area under the p-V curve.
From A to B (isochoric process), no work is done (W_AB = 0).
From B to C (isobaric process), W_BC = P ΔV = 200 J.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Heat transferred Q during the process from state A to state C is 200 J.
